https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/56251/ : SUCCESS
can you also update the test results on the machine that does not have compatible system interface implemented or entity manager not running ?

this is not correct, the getSubtree call should be made from a try catch block , it should not be inside the util function.

We should give the ability to handle exceptions from the clients that use this API (we cannot decide the clients exception behaviour).
redundant check ? this check is done at line number 465
why is this needed ? we are not using it anywhere right ?
can we add this in the load() , rather than repeating the same logic in other places ?
can we have func name as 'checkIfPlatformSpecific'  ?

We need to monitor interface added signal only if Entity Manager has not populated the interface when we checked. First we should check if xyz.openbmc_project.Configuration.IBMCompatibleSystem interface is populated by EM if not then only monitor for interface added signal.
This way you can avoid calling getConfigDir from bios_config.cpp file.

That will lead to a race condition, because if we try to get the xyz.openbmc_project.Configuration.IBMCompatibleSystem interface and entity manager would have already started and populated the interface and sent an interface added signal, and if we have not subscribed for the signal by then we would loose the signal. Hence it is always better to subscribe to the interface added signal in the constructors so that PLDM is always waiting on the notification and as soon as the interface is added we get that.

can we give any other func name?

if this is ibm specific should this is be under oem/ibm ?
Even though this is used only by IBM, this is a generic upstream solution to fetch the platform type.
why do you need this to be public ?
These variables can be declared as static variables under namespace pldm::responder and can be used in both functions getConfigDir and ibmCompatibleAddedCallback
this should have been in the try - catch block.
this is specific to bios right.. so should we say as MockBiosSystemConfig ?
is this required ? we are not using it anywhere ? & we would have already parsed this to see if it attribute_name key is present prior in this code itself right ?
also this "any" check seems redundant. if the key is not present..then anyways it is created for all platforms by default.

The any check was added because if the on a system there is no entity manager running, then the SystemType won't be populated, in that case it should pick the entry with *platform : "any"*.

So in the JSON there will be:
1. Platform: "any"- which indicates the default value for the Bios attribute 
2. Platform: "<Platform Name/Names>" - One or more entries with platform tag having the specific platform names. 

This function should return true(entry is compatible) if:
1. Platfrom tag does not exist - in this case it will pick the entry as is
2. Platform tag exists and it matches with the system type
3. Platform tag exists but EM is not running, in this case the entry with Platform: "any" should be picked.
@sagar - as we discussed over the discord call - lets have just absence of "platform" as our default. that would remove the "any" string dependency.
this logic should be inside the above above else condition ? you need to check the system type only when you have the platform key in the json.
should this not be getPlatformName() or some thing ?
which mapper call ? & what object path ? and what interface ?
please use an existing type definition for this.
make sure systemType is not empty before you reset the pointer ?
I prefer to separate this file into hpp and cpp
There only a couple of functions which is hosted by this file, so I assumed a single file would suffice.

I don't have a strong opinion.
@Manoj and @Tom, What do you think?

> I don't have a strong opinion.
> @Manoj and @Tom, What do you think?

Yes I don't have a strong preference either but, having code written in cpp would help in aiding better compilation times for incremental builds.

And I see that it has already been worked out & separated to cpp & hpp files.
Please use the variables defined in utils.hpp
Why not use the getDbusProperty method in the utils.hpp?

Can we update the example BIOS JSONs?

Also have we explored other possibilities like installing the bios jsons based on the platform or installing both jsons and loading based on the system type.

I general, I am not in favor of adding more complexity in the JSON which  make maintenance difficult.
does this work when sysType is empty ? is that tested ?
Yes, this is tested, if sysType is empty then it will pick from default Json folder.

well, this seems like the mock returns empty , so the sysType empty case seems to be tested.

But what about the non-empty case ?
Please add description of systemConfig here
Is this interface up streamed? This is IBM specific and doesn't look apt for common code.
